fancymenu.editor.add.image.desc:
A simple image.
Supports local and web sources.
fancymenu.editor.add.animation.desc:
An animation.
Similar to GIFs, but higher resolution.

To learn more about animations,
visit docs.fancymenu.net!
fancymenu.editor.custombutton.config.act: Send a chat message or command.
Open a link in your default browser.

Leave a world or server
and set a screen to open after.
fancymenu.element.general.pick_element.d:
List will all elements at the position
of the mouse cursor when
you opened this context menu.

Useful for when you need to
select an element that's behind
another one.
fancymenu.editor.custombutton.config.act:
Opens a screen by its identifier.

Supports vanilla/mod screens and
custom GUIs made with FancyMenu.

Reloads FancyMenu, including stuff like
panoramas, slideshows, etc.
fancymenu.editor.rightclick.scale.invali: Scale values can't be smaller than 0!
fancymenu.editor.items.button.btndescrip: Tooltip to display when the widget is getting hovered.
fancymenu.editor.object.moveup.desc:
Moves the element one layer up.

§l§xIMPORTANT:
Selected elements are always on top,
so you will not see the change
until you deselect the element.
fancymenu.editor.object.movedown.desc:
Moves the element one layer down.

§l§xIMPORTANT:
Selected elements are always on top,
so you will not see the change
until you deselect the element.
fancymenu.editor.items.orientation.btnde:
Sets the origin point from
where this element's position
should get calculated.

§zYou can see how an element
§zis affected by its anchor point
§zwhen you resize the editor window.
fancymenu.editor.add.slideshow.desc:
A slideshow.
To learn more about slideshows,
visit docs.fancymenu.net!
fancymenu.editor.add.shape.rectangle.des:
A rectangular shape.
Supports custom HEX RGBA colors.
fancymenu.editor.items.shape.color.btnde:
Set the HEX color of the shape.
Supports alpha channel (RGBA)!
fancymenu.editor.dynamicvariabletextfiel:
Add placeholders to the text that later
get replaced with values like the
player name or the Minecraft version.

Gets the version of a mod by its mod ID.

Just replace 'some_mod_id' in the placeholder
with an existing mod ID.

Gets the total mods count.
This includes disabled mods.

Gets the active mods count.
This doesn't include disabled mods.
fancymenu.editor.custombutton.config.act:
Closes the active screen.
Opens the title screen if not in a world.
fancymenu.editor.warning.unsaved:
Are you sure?

All unsaved changes for the current layout will get lost!
fancymenu.editor.items.splash.refresh.de:
Pick a new splash everytime the screen
is getting reloaded or opened.
fancymenu.fancymenu.editor.layoutoptions:
Add this layout to a group to randomly
pick one of the group's layouts
when opening the screen.

Can be used to randomize
backgrounds and other elements.

Set the group of this layout.
One layout per group gets picked
when opening the screen.

If layouts of this random group
should be random everytime the
screen gets opened or if only one layout
should be picked the first time
the screen gets opened.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.buttons.bu:
The highlighted background is used
when focusing the slider by using the
arrow/tab key navigation in screens.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.visibility: Check if the user is in singleplayer.
Check if the user is in multiplayer.

Check if a world is loaded.

A world is loaded when the user
is in a SP or MP world.
Check if the real time's current hour is X.
Check if the real time's current minute is X.
Check if the real time's current second is X.

Check if the window width is X.

§xCurrent Width: %s
§xCurrent Height: %s

Check if the window height is X.

§xCurrent Width: %s
§xCurrent Height: %s

Check if the window width is bigger than X.

§xCurrent Width: %s
§xCurrent Height: %s

Check if the window height is bigger than X.

§xCurrent Width: %s
§xCurrent Height: %s
Check for a specific game language.
Check if the game window is fullscreen.
Check if the operating system is Windows.
Check if the operating system is macOS.
Check if the operating system is Linux.

Check if a specific mod is loaded.

You can find the IDs of mods in the 'Mods' menu.
This menu is available by default
on Forge. On Fabric, download
the 'Mod Menu' mod.
Check if a specific server is online.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.copyid.btn:
Copy the ID of this element, to use
it in loading requirements, etc.
fancymenu.fancymenu.editor.dynamicvariab:
Localizes a text by the given key.

Just replace 'localization.key' in the
placeholder with a localization key.

§xCheck §ldocs.fancymenu.net §rfor how to add localizations!
fancymenu.helper.editor.properties.scale:
Force a GUI scale for this screen.

§xOnly overrides the scale for the
§xtarget screen, not for all screens!
fancymenu.helper.editor.properties.autos:
Let FancyMenu handle the scale
 of the screen, so your layout works
for every scale and resolution.

To do this, resize the window
until everything looks good and
elements are not too far apart
from each other and click on
this button.

§xThis will make text look blurry
§xat some scales.
§xThis can't be fixed and the best
§xworkaround is to use images
§xwith background as text elements.
Here you can set the base window size of your layout.
This should be the size your layout was designed for.
If you made it in the current window size, just leave the values like they are.
fancymenu.fancymenu.editor.dynamicvariab:
Gets the MOTD of a server.
Just replace 'someserver.com:25565'
with the actual server IP
and '1' with the MOTD line.
MOTDs only have 2 lines, so
the only valid line values are
'1' and '2'.

Gets the ping to a server.

Just replace 'someserver.com:25565' in the
placeholder with a valid server IP.

Gets the player count of a server.

Just replace 'someserver.com:25565' in the
placeholder with a valid server IP.

Gets the status (online/offline) of a server.

Just replace 'someserver.com:25565' in the
placeholder with a valid server IP.

Gets the MC version of a server.

Just replace 'someserver.com:25565' in the
placeholder with a valid server IP.
fancymenu.helper.editor.layoutoptions.ba:
Set an image, animation, panorama
or slideshow as background.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.orientatio:
Invalid Element ID!

No element found with the given ID!

Set the position of another element as
anchor point, so this element
will always move with the other one.

§xYou need the element ID
§xof the parent element here.
§xYou can get the element ID by
§xright-clicking the parent element.
fancymenu.commands.openguiscreen.error: [FANCYMENU] An error happened while trying to open a GUI via the /openguiscreen command!
fancymenu.editor.custombutton.config.act:
Mimic the click action of a Vanilla or mod button.

You need the §lwidget locator §rof
the button you want to mimic.

To get the widget locator, right-click
the button in the editor or enable
the Debug Overlay when not in the editor
then right-click the button.
fancymenu.fancymenu.editor.dynamicvariab:
Get the label/text of a Vanilla widget/button.

Replace 'some.menu.identifier:505280' with
the correct widget locator
of the target widget.

The widget locator points to a specific
widget in a specific screen.

§xYou can right-click widgets
§xin the editor to copy their locator.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.visibility:
Check if the current GUI scale is X.

You can check for bigger than ('>'),
smaller than ('<') and equals X.

For example, if you want to check
if the scale is smaller than 3.20,
type '<3.20' (without the '').
To check if the scale is equal to 1.0,
just type '1.0' (without the '').
When checking if the scale is bigger than 2.20,
type '>2.20' (without the '').
fancymenu.helper.editor.layoutoptions.un:
Add a screen to the blacklist
by its §lscreen identifier§r.

§xScreens on the blacklist will
§xbe ignored by the layout, so
§xthe customizations don't get
§xapplied to this screen.

§xYou can get the identifier
§xof a screen by clicking on
§x§lCustomization -> Copy Identifier of Current Screen
§r§xwhile in the screen.

§x§lAre you sure?

Do you really want to §xremove §rthis identifier?

§x§lAre you sure?

Do you really want to §xclear §rthe blacklist?

Add a screen to the whitelist
by its §lscreen identifier§r.

§xIf there are screens on the
§xwhitelist, only these screens
§xwill be customized by the layout.
§xAll other screens will be ignored!

§xYou can get the identifier
§xof a screen by clicking on
§x§lCustomization -> Copy Identifier of Current Screen
§r§xwhile in the screen.

§x§lAre you sure?

Do you really want to §xremove §rthis identifier?

§x§lAre you sure?

Do you really want to §xclear §rthe whitelist?
fancymenu.fancymenu.editor.dynamicvariab:
Picks a random line from a TXT file.

Supports custom change intervals for lines.

Just replace 'randomtexts.txt' with the path to
your TXT file and replace '10' with the
change interval in seconds.
An interval of 0 will make it
pick a line only once per session.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.visibility: Check if the real time's current day is X.
Check if the real time's current month is X.
Check if the real time's current year is X.
Used to display Beta build warnings and other things.
Store variables to use them
for placeholders and
loading requirements.
fancymenu.helper.buttonaction.paste_to_c:
Paste text to the
chat input field.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.get_variabl:
Gets the value of a stored variable.

Just replace 'some_variable' with
the actual variable name.
fancymenu.helper.visibilityrequirement.i:
Check if the value of a stored variable is X.
This only supports FancyMenu's own variable system.
It does not support mod variables or Vanilla variables.
Variable Name & Value to Check For
Check if the current server IP is X.
Check if a layout is enabled.
fancymenu.helper.buttonaction.toggle_lay: Toggle a layout (Enable/Disable) by its name.
fancymenu.helper.buttonaction.enable_lay: Enable a layout by its name.
fancymenu.helper.buttonaction.disable_la: Disable a layout by its name.
fancymenu.helper.visibilityrequirement.g:
Check if the player is
currently in survival mode.

Check if the player is
currently in creative mode.

Check if the player is
currently in adventure mode.

Check if the player is
currently in spectator mode.
fancymenu.customization.items.input_fiel:
A text input field.

Can be used to set variable
values by user input.

Link this text field to a variable.
Use the variable name.

The variable can be a new
or an existing variable.

Set the type of this text field.

The type defines what characters
the user can use in the field.

For example:
If the field is
set to "Only Numbers", the
user will only be able to
type numbers into the field.
fancymenu.customization.items.slider.des:
A slider button.

Can be used to set variable
values by user input.
fancymenu.customization.items.slider.edi:
Set the type of this slider.

When using the list type,
you can set a list of
text values and switch through
them when moving the slider.

The range type allows you
to switch through a range
of numbers.
You can set a min and a max value
when using this type.

The prefix of the slider label.

The base of the slider label
is always the current value.

The suffix of the slider label.

The base of the slider label
is always the current value.

Set text values for the list slider.
§xOne value per text line.

Link this slider to a variable.
Use the variable name.

The variable can be a new
or an existing variable.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.vanilla_bu:
The widget locator points to a
specific widget in a specific screen.

§zThe widget locator is used for actions like 'Mimic Button'.
Allows you to override the text at the
top of some screens with a custom one.

§xThis option might not work for some screens.

§xYou can't edit the title of Custom GUIs.
§xTo edit Custom GUI titles, edit the GUI in
§xthe 'Manage Custom GUIs' screen.

§xThe title needs to be at least 1 character long.
§xSpaces count as characters.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.visibility:
Check if the real time's current week day is X.

The first day of the week is sunday!
fancymenu.customization.items.text.desc:
Add a text to render in
your layout.

Choose between local and online
sources for the text content.
fancymenu.customization.items.text.base_:
Set the base color for the text.
Use HEX color codes.
fancymenu.customization.items.text.sourc:
§zDirect Text:
Directly input a text to render.

§zLocal Source:
Use a TXT file as source.

§zWeb Source:
Use the plain text content
of a website as source.

§xChanging the source mode will
§xreset the text content!

§xYou can undo source changing
§xby pressing §lCTRL + Z§r§x!
fancymenu.customization.items.text.set_s: Set direct text content to render.

Get the plain web text content
of a website as text.
Use a TXT file as content.
fancymenu.customization.items.text.text_:
The text border is the space
between the text and the left
and right side of the element.
fancymenu.customization.items.text.scrol:
The color of the grabber.
Use HEX color codes.
fancymenu.customization.items.text.markd: If the element should parse Markdown formatting codes.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.json.desc:
Parse a JSON and get a
value from it.

Replace 'path_or_link_to_json' with
the path or link to the
JSON file you want to parse.

Replace '$.some.json.path' with the
JSON path to the value you want
to get.

§zGo to §ljson.fancymenu.net §r§zto learn
§zmore about JSON paths.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.webtext.des:
Gets the first line of
plain text content from a website.

Replace 'http://somewebsite.com/textfile.txt'
with the link to the page you
want to get the text from.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.absolute_pa:
Returns the absolute path
of a file/folder.
fancymenu.fancymenu.editor.dynamicvariab: The width of the current screen.
The height of the current screen.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.stringify.d:
Stringifies a text by escaping all
syntax characters ( " { } ).

This is useful when nesting other
placeholders as value. If the
replaced nested placeholder could
contain syntax characters that aren't
part of another placeholder, you need
to escape them.

§xPlaceholders in the value will be
§xreplaced first, so you don't need
§xto worry about them getting stringified.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.elementheig:
Gets the height of an element
by its element ID.

Just replace 'some.element.id' with
the actual element ID.

§xYou can get the ID of elements
§xby right-clicking them in the editor.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.elementwidt:
Gets the width of an element
by its element ID.

Just replace 'some.element.id' with
the actual element ID.

§xYou can get the ID of elements
§xby right-clicking them in the editor.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.elementposx:
Gets the X position of an element
by its element ID.

Just replace 'some.element.id' with
the actual element ID.

§xYou can get the ID of elements
§xby right-clicking them in the editor.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.elementposy:
Gets the Y position of an element
by its element ID.

Just replace 'some.element.id' with
the actual element ID.

§xYou can get the ID of elements
§xby right-clicking them in the editor.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.calc.desc:
Solves arithmetic expressions.

Just replace the example expression
with the real one.

Set 'decimal' to 'false' if the
placeholder should return a LONG
instead of a DOUBLE.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.random_numb:
Returns a random number in the specified range.
Returns a different number every tick,
so it's recommended to use the
placeholder in combination with
a variable or something else to
control the refresh rate.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.mouseposx.d:
Gets the mouse X position.

§xAlways returns 10 while in the editor,
§xso you can still edit the element
§xwithout it following your mouse when
§xusing it for advanced sizing/positioning.
fancymenu.helper.placeholder.mouseposy.d:
Gets the mouse Y position.

§xAlways returns 10 while in the editor,
§xso you can still edit the element
§xwithout it following your mouse when
§xusing it for advanced sizing/positioning.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.visibility:
Check if a text matches another.

Compare Modes:
equals, contains, starts-with, ends-with

Set the 3 dots after the 'mode' variable
to the compare mode you want to use.

Set the 3 dots after the 'text' variable
to the text you want to check.

Set the 3 dots after the 'compare_with'
variable to the text you want to
compare the first one with.

§xYou can check for multiple texts/modes
§xat once by separating multiple
§xcompare sections by comma.

Check if a number matches another.

Compare Modes:
equals, bigger-than, smaller-than,
bigger-than-or-equals,
smaller-than-or-equals

Set the 3 dots after the 'mode' variable
to the compare mode you want to use.

Set the 3 dots after the 'number' variable
to the number you want to check.

Set the 3 dots after the 'compare_with'
variable to the number you want to
compare the first one with.

§xYou can check for multiple numbers/modes
§xat once by separating multiple
§xcompare sections by comma.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.features.a:
§xONLY FOR ADVANCED USERS!

Allows you to manually set the
position of the element.

Advanced positions support placeholders,
so you can calculate positions
by using the Calculator placeholder,
get positions of other elements
and much more.

Many useful placeholders for element
positioning can be found
in the "GUI" and "Advanced"
placeholder categories.

§xYou will not be able to resize or
§xdrag and move the element while this
§xfeature is in use.

§xONLY FOR ADVANCED USERS!

Allows you to manually set the
size of the element.

Advanced sizes support placeholders,
so you can calculate sizes
by using the Calculator placeholder,
get sizes of other elements
and much more.

Many useful placeholders for element
sizing can be found
in the "GUI" and "Advanced"
placeholder categories.

§xYou will not be able to resize
§xthe element on axes that got
§xoverridden by an advanced size.
fancymenu.helper.editor.properties.autos:
You need to set a §lforced GUI scale
before you can use auto-scaling!

It's recommended to use 2 as
forced GUI scale.

§xTo set a forced GUI scale,
§xright-click the editor background
§xand click on §lForce GUI Scale§r§x.
fancymenu.customization.items.ticker.des:
Allows you to execute actions
every tick.

Supports asynchronous ticking
and tick delays.

Can be set to tick only once
every time you open the screen.

§xThis element is only visible
§xin the editor.
fancymenu.customization.items.ticker.tic: Set the delay between ticks in milliseconds.
fancymenu.customization.items.ticker.asy:
If the ticker should run in
a separate thread (asynchronous).
fancymenu.customization.items.ticker.tic:
§lNormal: §rTicker ticks every tick.

§lSession: §rTicker ticks once per game session.

§lOn Load Screen: §rTicker ticks once every time you load the screen.
Keep in mind that screens also get
reloaded when resizing the game window.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.visibility:
Check if an element is hovered.
Use its element ID to identify it.

You can get the ID of an element
by right-clicking it in the editor.

Checks if ANY element is hovered.
This can be anything, not just buttons.

Checks if ANY button is hovered.
Includes Vanilla and custom buttons.

Check if a button is active (clickable).
Use its element ID to identify it.

You can get the ID of an element
by right-clicking it in the editor.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.playerenti:
Automatically make the entity look
like the client player.

Copies the name, skin and cape.

§xYou can't do this while
§x"Copy Client Player" is enabled.

Set the player's name.

You can use any name here,
it doesn't have to be an
existing user.

Tries to automatically pick
the skin based on the
element's player name.

§xYou can't do this while
§x"Auto Skin" is enabled.

Tries to automatically pick
the cape based on the
element's player name.

§xYou can't do this while
§x"Auto Cape" is enabled.

Set the entity's scale.

Default scale is 30.
If the skin should be slim.
If the player name should be visible.

If the player should have a parrot
on their shoulder.

If the player's shoulder parrot
should be on the left shoulder.
If the player should be a baby.
fancymenu.ui.text_editor.error.multiline: Multiline text is not supported by the target.
fancymenu.editor.loading_requirement.ele:
Manage this element's loading requirements.

Loading requirements can be used to
specify under which circumstances
an element should load/be visible.
fancymenu.editor.loading_requirement.lay:
Manage this layout's loading requirements.

Loading requirements can be used to
specify under which circumstances
a layout should load/be visible.
fancymenu.editor.loading_requirement.scr:
§x§lAre you sure?

Do you really want to §xremove §rthe selected requirement?
This action cannot be undone!

§x§lAre you sure?

Do you really want to §xremove §rthe selected group?
This action cannot be undone!

The requirement mode defines what
the requirement should tell its parent
when its condition is met.

§zNORMAL §rmeans, it returns TRUE ("Yes, load!")
when its condition is met.

§zOPPOSITE §rmeans, it returns TRUE when
its condition is NOT met.

§zThis requirement has no value.
§zYou don't need to set one.
Edit the value of the chosen requirement.
§xYou need to select a requirement first!
§xYou need to edit the requirement value first!

The group mode defines how the group
should handle its requirements.

§zAND §rmeans, ALL requirements need
to be TRUE, which basically just
means they need to say "Yes, load!".

§zOR §rmeans, only ONE requirement
needs to be TRUE.
§xYou need to add at least one requirement first!

§xThe group identifier is already used
§xfor another group!
Add a requirement to this group.
§xYou need to select a requirement first!

Add a new requirement group.

Requirement groups can hold multiple
requirements and basically
make them one big requirement.

Requirement groups have two modes.
In §zAND §rmode, all requirements need
to return TRUE (which means "Yes, load!"),
but in §zOR §rmode, only one requirement
needs to return TRUE.
§xYou need to select a group or requirement!
Edit the selected group or requirement.
Remove the selected group or requirement.
fancymenu.editor.action.screens.finish.n: §xYou need to select an action first!
fancymenu.editor.action.screens.remove_a:
§x§lAre you sure?

Do you really want to §xremove §rthe selected action?
This cannot be undone!
fancymenu.editor.action.screens.build_sc: Edit the value of this action.

§zThis action has no value.
§zYou don't need to set one.
§xYou need to edit the action value first!
fancymenu.editor.action.screens.move_act:
Moves the selected entry up in the
list, so it gets executed earlier.
This is more precise than using
drag-&-drop to move entries.

Moves the selected entry down in the
list, so it gets executed later.
This is more precise than using
drag-&-drop to move entries.
fancymenu.editor.elements.button.manage_:
Manage the actions this button
should execute when clicked.
fancymenu.editor.elements.ticker.manage_:
Manage the actions this ticker
should execute.
fancymenu.background.image.desc:
Well, it's an image.
Works with JPEG, PNG, APNG, etc.
Supports local and web images.
fancymenu.background.image.configure.sli: Slide Wide Images From Left To Right: %s
fancymenu.background.image.configure.no_: §xYou need to choose an image or set an image URL first!
fancymenu.background.image.type.web.fall:
Set an (optional) fallback image that gets
displayed in case the main image fails to load.
fancymenu.background.animation.desc:
An animation.
See docs.fancymenu.net for details.
fancymenu.background.animation.configure: §xYou need to choose an animation first!
fancymenu.background.slideshow.desc:
An image slideshow.

fancymenu.background.panorama.desc:
A moving panorama cube.
Similar to the Title Screen background.
See docs.fancymenu.net for details.
fancymenu.animation.choose.no_animation_: §xYou need to select an animation first!
fancymenu.slideshow.choose.no_slideshow_: §xYou need to select a slideshow first!
fancymenu.panorama.choose.no_panorama_se: §xYou need to select a panorama first!
fancymenu.menu_background.choose.not_con: §xYou need to configure the background first!
fancymenu.menu_background.choose.not_bac: §xYou need to select a background type first!
fancymenu.elements.vanilla_button.draggi: §cTo move this element, change its anchor point first!
fancymenu.editor.saving_failed.generic:
§x§fUnable to save layout!
An error happened while trying to save the layout!
fancymenu.editor.render_custom_behind_va:
If all non-vanilla elements should
get rendered behind vanilla elements.

Since you can't change the order
of vanilla elements, this is the only
way to have some kind of control over it.
fancymenu.editor.open_audio.desc: Play an audio when opening the screen.
fancymenu.editor.close_audio.desc: Play an audio when closing the screen.
fancymenu.element.elements.splash_text.d:
A splash text like the bouncing
text in the Title screen.
fancymenu.elements.vanilla_button.copyri: §cYou can't move the Copyright button out-of-screen!
fancymenu.elements.multiselect.loading_r:
§x§lOverride Loading Requirements?

The selected elements have different loading requirements!
All of their loading requirements will get §xoverridden§r!

Continue?
fancymenu.ui.filechooser.resource_name_c:
The name of this directory or file contains
unsupported characters.
Make sure to only use [a-z], [0-9] and [_], [-], [.].
Spaces and uppercase letters are not supported.
fancymenu.ui.save_file.save.override_war:
Override File?

Do you want to override the existing file?
fancymenu.layout.manage.delete.confirm:
§x§lDelete Layout?

Do you really want to §xdelete §rthis layout?

You can't undo this!
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.customization: §xYou can't turn off customization for custom GUIs.

The screen identifier is used in
many places of the customization system.
It's used to get the correct layouts
for a screen and it's part of the
button locator, which is basically a 'path'
to a button in a menu.

Are you sure?

This will §xcompletely hide §rthe menu bar!

To make the bar §xvisible §ragain, press §xCTRL + ALT + C§r!

Do you want to hide the bar now?

This is only for advanced users!

§xYou can break your game with that stuff!

The default GUI scale gets set
when the user starts the game for
the very first time.

This is useful for modpack developers.

Set a custom skip text that
replaces the default one.
Supports localization keys and plain text.
§xYou need to set all icons first!

Wrong Resolution!

The icon has to be %s!

Set a custom window title that replaces
the default 'Minecraft 1.X.X' title.

Custom GUIs are entirely self-made
menus, which allows you to add new
screens to the game without the need
to customize an existing one.
You can open custom GUIs by simply
using the action to open GUIs.

§xIt is also possible to override
§xexisting Vanilla/Mod screens with
§xcustom GUIs, but this is not
§xrecommended and should only be
§xused if it is not possible to edit
§xthe GUI with a normal layout.

§xYou need to enable the advanced
§xcustomization mode to override screens.

Will disable customization for ALL screens!
This can't be undone!

§xAre you sure?

This will disable customization for ALL screens!

Do you want to disable customization for all screens now?

You need to enable customization for
the current screen first.

You need to enable customization for
the current screen first.
Join the Discord server for quick help
and a great community to hang out with!
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.help.wiki.too:
The FancyMenu docs have guides for everything
you need to know about the mod!
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.help.cursefor:
You can find and share FancyMenu setups
in the FancyMenu category on CurseForge!
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.tools.dummy_s:
Dummy instances of screens can be used
to edit screens that would normally
close pretty quickly or editing normal
instances of them would cause problems.

§xYou can force-close dummy screens
§xby using the "Force-Close Current Screen"
§xoption in the "Customization" tab.
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.tools.dirt_me:
Used whenever you see just a simple
message with a dirt background.
Also used (beside other screens) when
connecting to a SP/MP world.
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.tools.dummy_s: This one is shown right before a world finishes loading.
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.variables.des:
Variables allow you to store data in
text format via actions, which you can
then read via loading requirements, etc.
This is useful for advanced layout setups.
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.variables.man:
§xAre you sure?

Do you really want to delete this variable?
This can't be undone!
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.user_interfac:
How fast sub menus should open when
hovering over its entry.
fancymenu.elements.element.stay_on_scree:
Will prevent the element from going
out of the visible screen area
when resizing the window or changing
the GUI scale.
fancymenu.markdown.missing_local_image: [MISSING LOCAL IMAGE OR NOT IN CONFIG/FANCYMENU/ASSETS]
fancymenu.customization.scroll_lists.des:
Some screens have headers and footers.
For the most part these screens are
scrollable screens like the Singleplayer Screen,
but also some newer screens like the new
Create World Screen has a header for its tabs.
A custom cursor that gets show
instead of the default one.

It's possible that the cursor behaviour
varies between operating systems.

Make sure the texture is a PNG RGBA image
and is not too large.
32x32 or 64x64 pixel should be enough.

The hotspot of a cursor is the
pixel of the cursor texture where
clicks get registered.
For a normal arrow cursor, this
would be the tip of the arrow.

The X0 Y0 coordinate of a texture
is at its top-left corner.

The hotspot of a cursor is the
pixel of the cursor texture where
clicks get registered.
For a normal arrow cursor, this
would be the tip of the arrow.

The X0 Y0 coordinate of a texture
is at its top-left corner.

Shows the custom cursor in the editor
when hovering over the cursor element.
fancymenu.customization.items.text.v2.de:
Renders a text body.
It support multi-line text, markdown
and has many options to customize
the look and feel of the element
and its content.
fancymenu.editor.elements.deprecated_war: DEPRECATED ELEMENT! This element type gets removed in the future!
There should be a new version of this element type.
You should replace this element with the new version.
fancymenu.editor.loading_requirements.is:
Checks for a specific screen title.
Screen titles are the names of GUIs you can see in some GUIs like
the Options or Pause screen.
Plain Text Title or Localization Key
fancymenu.game_intro.desc:
Plays an animated image or video before the
Title Screen is shown for the first time.
fancymenu.custom_guis.manage.remove.conf:
Are you sure?

Do you really want to remove the GUI?
fancymenu.custom_guis.build.identifier.a: Identifier already in use! Identifiers need to be unique!
fancymenu.custom_guis.build.title: Screen Title (Optional):
fancymenu.custom_guis.override.confirm:
Are you sure?

Overriding screens can cause unexpected game behavior.
Do you really want to override the screen now?
Remove override rules for Vanilla/mod screens.

Are you sure?

Do you really want to remove the override rule?
fancymenu.placeholders.world_load_progre:
Reflects the world loading progress
while in a Progress Screen.
Can be used to make loading bars, etc.
fancymenu.editor.elements.progress_bar.d:
A customizable progress bar which
supports setting a custom text source
for the current progress.
fancymenu.editor.elements.progress_bar.b:
The bar color is used in case there
is no bar texture defined for the element.

If a bar texture is defined,
the bar color will be ignored.

The background color is used in case there
is no background texture defined for the element.

If a background texture is defined,
the background color will be ignored.
fancymenu.editor.elements.progress_bar.p:
Use the current progress of this progress bar
as anchor origin position when using
this element as Element anchor.
That way other elements move with
the progress of the progress bar.
fancymenu.editor.elements.progress_bar.s:
The progress source is the current progress
as percentage number between 0 and 100 or
floating point number between 0.0 and 1.0,
depending on the progress value mode.
The source supports placeholders, so there's
nothing that holds you from getting creative!
fancymenu.editor.actions.execute_termina: The action will only get executed for OSes that have a command.
If an unknown OS is used, the action will fallback to the Linux command.
fancymenu.editor.actions.paste_to_chat.a:
If the action should append the text to existing
text that is already typed in the input field.
The action will override existing text if this is disabled.
fancymenu.editor.layout.index.desc:
The layout index is useful when you have
multiple layouts active for the same screen.
If these layouts need get loaded
in a specific order, use the layout index.
The bigger the index, the later the layout
gets loaded, which means it is ON TOP OF
layouts with a smaller index.

For example: A layout with index 1 will
be under a layout with index 2.
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.leave_current:
Force-closes the current screen and brings
you back to the Title Screen.
Useful for when you're stuck in a screen
without an option to leave it.
Allows you to edit Minecraft's config options.
fancymenu.actions.update_screen.desc:
Updates the current screen.
This is useful if you need to rebuild its
elements (like images, custom buttons, etc.),
or after changing the GUI scale or other
options that need the screen to get updated.
It's basically the same as resizing the window.
fancymenu.placeholders.minecraft_option_:
Gets the current value of a Minecraft option.
For a list of valid option names, take a look at
the 'options.txt' file of your Minecraft instance.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.desc:
A slider button that can be used to
set variable values and more.
Executes actions on value change.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.pre_selecte:
This is the value that will be pre-selected
when the slider gets created, so make
sure this points to a variable or something
the slider sets.
If the slider sets a Minecraft option,
point this to the option value.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.label: Slider Label
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.label.desc:
The label of the slider.

To show the current slider value as part
of the label, use the §x$$value§r placeholder.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.type.list.s:
Set text values for the list slider.
One value per text line.
At least two values (lines) needed.
The minimum value the range slider can reach.
The maximum value the range slider can reach.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.manage_acti:
The actions this slider will execute
when its value gets changed.

You can get the slider's current value
by using the §x$$value§r placeholder in
action values or requirement values.
The decimal place to round the value to.
One (1) decimal place is one place
after the decimal point.

To not round the value, set it to §x-1§r.
fancymenu.resources.source_type.location:
This source type uses Minecraft's own resource
system to get resources, so in other words,
it can use resources of resource packs,
Vanilla Minecraft and mods.

Here you need to input the resource location
of the resource you want to use.
Resource locations consist of two parts.
The first part is the namespace and the second
part is the path.
These two parts are separated by a colon (:).

To learn more about resource locations,
please visit resources.fancymenu.net!
fancymenu.resources.source_type.local.de:
This source type lets you load local resources
saved in Minecraft's instance directory.
You need to save all of FancyMenu's resources
to '/config/fancymenu/assets/'.
fancymenu.resources.source_type.web.desc:
This source type lets you use web resources via URL.
Resource URLs should ALWAYS be DIRECT URLs,
which means they should point directly to the
resource and end with the resource's name + extension.
URLs also need to start with http:// or https://.

§xUsing non-direct URLs will hurt the performance!
fancymenu.resources.chooser_screen.legac:
This is a non-asset local source!
Most features are disabled until you set a valid asset source!
To set an asset source, use the "Choose Resource" button.
fancymenu.resources.chooser_screen.no_ex:
The source has no valid file extension suffix!
This could mean you're using placeholders that dynamically build the source.
Make sure to only use file types from the "Allowed File Types" list!
fancymenu.elements.text.v2.source_mode.d:
§lDirect: §rInput text content via text editor.
§lResource: §rSet a source file to get the text content from.
If this element should be interactable.
Disable this if you experience problems with
clicking elements above or under this text element.
fancymenu.placeholders.error.text_too_lo: §c§lERROR: §rText too long to parse placeholders! 17,000 characters at max!
fancymenu.placeholders.loader_version.de: Gets the version of the mod loader (Forge, Fabric, etc.).
fancymenu.placeholders.loader_name.desc: Gets the name of the mod loader (Forge, Fabric, etc.).
fancymenu.placeholders.screen_identifier: Gets the identifier of the active screen.
fancymenu.elements.audio.desc:
Audio elements allow you to play
audio files in screens.
Supports multiple audios per element!
fancymenu.elements.audio.manage_audios.r:
Are you sure?

Do you really want to remove the selected audio track?
fancymenu.elements.audio.disable_vanilla:
Disabling Vanilla Music in Screens

You can disable the music that plays in screens
in FancyMenu's menu bar at the top of every screen,
when you're §lNOT§r in the editor.

To toggle it off, disable: 
§zCustomization -> Settings -> Play Vanilla Music in Screens
fancymenu.editor.anchor_overlay.change_a:
If the anchor of elements should get changed when
hovering over anchor areas (the rectangles in all edges).

You need to drag elements to change their anchors on hover.

If the anchor of elements should get changed to the
"Other Element" anchor when hovering over other elements.

You need to drag elements to change their anchors on hover.
fancymenu.editor.anchor_overlay.invert_c:
Inverts the colors of what's behind the overlay,
so the overlay is always visible.

Enabling this disables custom colors and opacity.
fancymenu.editor.anchor_overlay.charging:
How long you need to hover an anchor area/element
to change the anchor point of an element.
fancymenu.editor.auto_scaling.disable_fo:
§xYou need to disable §lauto-scaling §r§xfirst
§xbefore editing the forced GUI scale.
fancymenu.placeholders.max_number.desc: Returns the greater of two numbers.
fancymenu.placeholders.min_number.desc: Returns the smaller of two numbers.
fancymenu.placeholders.pi.desc: Returns the double value that is closer than any other to §opi§r, the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter.
fancymenu.placeholders.absolute_number.d:
Returns the absolute (positive) value of the given number.
If the given number is absolute, the given number is returned.
fancymenu.placeholders.negate_number.des:
Returns the negation of the given number.
If the given number is negative, the given number is returned.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_sin.desc: Returns the trigonometric sine of an angle.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_sinh.desc: Returns the hyperbolic sine of a double value.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_cos.desc: Returns the trigonometric cosine of an angle.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_cosh.desc: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a double value.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_tan.desc: Returns the trigonometric tangent of an angle.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_tanh.desc: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of a double value.
fancymenu.placeholders.unix_time.desc:
The current time in milliseconds, measured by the time
that has elapsed since 00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970.
fancymenu.overlay.debug.toggle.desc:
The debug overlay shows useful information
about FancyMenu and the current screen.
It can also help with performance optimization.
fancymenu.overlay.debug.loaded_animation: Too many animation frames! Recommended total frames (all animations combined) are 500!
The resolution of at least one animation is too high! Recommended max resolution is 1080p!
fancymenu.overlay.debug.right_click_elem: §bRight-click highlighted elements to copy their widget locator and more!
fancymenu.menu_background.deprecated.det:
This background type is deprecated and gets
removed or replaced in the future.
It is also possible that there is already an
alternative available.
fancymenu.resources.pre_loading.desc:
Set resources to pre-load on game start,
so they are ready to use once the game
loading process is completed.
fancymenu.resources.pre_loading.manage.r:
Remove Resource?

Do you really want to remove the selected resource?
fancymenu.placeholders.jvm_cpu_usage.des: Gets the current CPU usage of the Java Virtual Machine.
fancymenu.placeholders.os_cpu_usage.desc: Gets the current CPU usage of the Operating System.
fancymenu.placeholders.os.desc: The name of the Operating System.
fancymenu.placeholders.jvm_name.desc: The name of the Java Virtual Machine.
fancymenu.elements.widgets.generic.navig:
If the user should be able to focus this
widget by using the Tab/Arrow key navigation.
fancymenu.actions.open_screen.error:
Failed to open screen!

FancyMenu failed to open the given screen via the 'Open Screen' action!
In most cases this means the screen is not supported by FancyMenu,
because it's a non-Vanilla screen from another mod.

If the screen is a Vanilla screen, please report this bug via GitHub.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_button.error:
Failed to mimic button!

FancyMenu failed to mimic the click action of a button.
In most cases this means FancyMenu failed to open the original screen
this button is part of, because the screen is not supported.
Most unsupported screens are non-Vanilla screens from other mods.

If the screen is a Vanilla screen, please report this bug via GitHub.
fancymenu.elements.music_controller.desc:
Element to control Vanilla music that plays in menus.

This element can't control music that plays
in worlds while no screen is open.
It is only to control music while a screen is open.
fancymenu.elements.music_controller.play:
This type of music plays in menus when NO world is loaded,
like in the Title screen for example.

This type of music plays in menus when a world is loaded.
It's basically the normal world music that
keeps playing in menus that don't pause the game,
like the inventory in SP and every menu in MP.
fancymenu.commands.closeguiscreen.error: [FANCYMENU] Failed to close GUI screen via /closeguiscreen command!
fancymenu.commands.variable.get.error: [FANCYMENU] Failed to get variable via /fmvariable command!
fancymenu.commands.variable.set.error: [FANCYMENU] Failed to set variable via /fmvariable command!
fancymenu.editor.background.show_overlay: Show Dark Overlay On Custom Background: %s

If the dark overlay rendered by Vanilla Minecraft
should be visible on custom backgrounds.
fancymenu.editor.background.blur_backgro:
If Vanilla's background blur should get
applied to the custom background.
